page.title: 17Science
page.content: Pliocene marine formation at St.Erth Pliocene is the last geological period and system of rocks before the Pleistocene Ice Age, the beginning of the Pliocene Age is unequivocably marked by a marine transgression. Pliocene rocks are fully developed in Britain, their only representations being a shelly deposit known as 'crags' in East Anglia, and small deposits of sand in Kent and here at St.Erth in Cornwall. Here at St.Erth a deposit of high quality moulding - sand which has been exploited intermittently since the early part of the nineteenth century. It gave rise to an important foundry at Hayle, where large castings for many early iron structures in Britain were made.
